SEARCH
Package fr.campus.loic.squaregames.model.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
fr.campus.loic.squaregames.model.game.Game
Direct Known Subclasses:
Connect4, Gomoku, TicTacToe
public abstract class Game extends Object
Abstract base class for all board-based games.

Provides common functionality such as managing the board, players, turns, and victory condition checking. Supports both gravity-based and non-gravity games.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int height, int width, int victoryCondition, String rules, boolean gravity)
      Creates a new game instance with the specified board size, victory condition, rules, and gravity.
      Parameters:
      height - the number of rows on the board
      width - the number of columns on the board
      victoryCondition - the number of consecutive tiles required to win
      rules - a description of the game rules
      gravity - true if gravity affects tile placement; false otherwise

  • Method Details

    • setOwner

      public void setOwner(int col, int row, Player player)
      Sets the owner of a tile and updates its visual representation.
      Parameters:
      col - the column index
      row - the row index
      player - the player who owns the tile

    • playerTurn

      public void playerTurn(Player player, int[] move)
      Executes a single turn for the given player by marking the selected tile.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose turn it is
      move - the coordinates [col, row] of the chosen tile

    • isNotEmpty

      public boolean isNotEmpty(int col, int row)
      Checks if the tile at the given coordinates is not empty.
      Parameters:
      col - the column index of the tile
      row - the row index of the tile
      Returns:
      false if the tile is empty, true otherwise

    • sameOwner

      public boolean sameOwner(int col1, int row1, int col2, int row2)
      Checks if two tiles have the same owner (i.e., the same representation).
      Parameters:
      col1 - the column index of the first tile
      row1 - the row index of the first tile
      col2 - the column index of the second tile
      row2 - the row index of the second tile
      Returns:
      true if both tiles have the same owner, false otherwise

    • checkWinnerCondition

      public boolean checkWinnerCondition(int condition)
      Checks if there is a winning sequence on the board for the given condition length.

      The method tests each tile in four directions: horizontal, vertical, and the two diagonals. If a sequence of condition consecutive tiles with the same owner is found, it returns true.

      Parameters:
      condition - the number of consecutive tiles needed to win
      Returns:
      true if a winning sequence exists, false otherwise

    • hasPawnAt

      public boolean hasPawnAt(int col, int row)
      Checks if there is a pawn at the specified tile.
      Parameters:
      col - the column index
      row - the row index
      Returns:
      true if the tile is occupied, false otherwise
